name: bulbasaur
bio:
The seed on its
back is filled
with nutrients. The seed grows
steadily larger as
its body grows.

name: ivysaur
bio:
Exposure to sun­
light adds to its
strength. Sunlight also makes the bud
on its back grow
larger.

name: venusaur
bio:
By spreading the
broad petals of
its flower and catching the sun's
rays, it fills its
body with power.

name: charmander
bio:
The flame on its
tail shows the
strength of its life force. If it
is weak, the flame
also burns weakly.

name: charmeleon
bio:
It is very hot­
headed by nature,
so it constantly seeks opponents.
It calms down only
when it wins.

name: charizard
bio:
If CHARIZARD be­
comes furious, the
flame at the tip of its tail flares
up in a whitish-
blue color.

name: squirtle
bio:
The shell is soft
when it is born.
It soon becomes so resilient, prod­
ding fingers will
bounce off it.

name: wartortle
bio:
It is recognized
as a symbol of
longevity. If its shell has algae on
it, that WARTORTLE
is very old.

name: blastoise
bio:
It deliberately
makes itself heavy
so it can with­ stand the recoil
of the water jets
it fires.

name: caterpie
bio:
Its short feet
are tipped with
suction pads that enable it to
tirelessly climb
slopes and walls.

name: metapod
bio:
Inside the shell,
it is soft and
weak as it pre­ pares to evolve.
It stays motion­
less in the shell.

name: butterfree
bio:
It collects honey
every day. It rubs
honey onto the hairs on its legs
to carry it back
to its nest.

name: weedle
bio:
Its poison stinger
is very powerful.
Its bright-colored body is intended
to warn off its
enemies.

name: kakuna
bio:
Although it is a
cocoon, it can
move a little. It can extend its
poison barb if it
is attacked.

name: beedrill
bio:
It has 3 poisonous
stingers on its
forelegs and its tail. They are
used to jab its
enemy repeatedly.

name: pidgey
bio:
It usually hides
in tall grass. Be­
cause it dislikes fighting, it pro­
tects itself by
kicking up sand.

name: pidgeotto
bio:
It has outstanding
vision. However
high it flies, it is able to distin­
guish the move­
ments of its prey.

name: pidgeot
bio:
Its well-developed
chest muscles make
it strong enough to whip up a gusty
windstorm with
just a few flaps.

name: rattata
bio:
Will chew on any­
thing with its
fangs. If you see one, it is certain
that 40 more live
in the area.

name: raticate
bio:
Its hind feet are
webbed. They act
as flippers, so it can swim in
rivers and hunt
for prey.

name: spearow
bio:
Inept at flying
high. However, it
can fly around very fast to
protect its ter­
ritory.

name: fearow
bio:
It shoots itself
suddenly high into
the sky, then plummets down in
one fell swoop to
strike its prey.

name: ekans
bio:
It can freely de­
tach its jaw to
swallow large prey whole. It can be­
come too heavy to
move, however.

name: arbok
bio:
Transfixing prey
with the face-like
pattern on its belly, it binds
and poisons the
frightened victim.

name: pikachu
bio:
This intelligent
POKéMON roasts
hard BERRIES with electricity to
make them tender
enough to eat.

name: raichu
bio:
When electricity
builds up inside
its body, it becomes feisty.
It also glows in
the dark.

name: sandshrew
bio:
If it fell from a
great height, this
POKéMON could save itself by rolling
into a ball and
bouncing.

name: sandslash
bio:
In an attempt to
hide itself, it
will run around at top speed to
kick up a blinding
dust storm.

name: nidoran-f
bio:
The poison hidden
in its small horn
is extremely po­ tent. Even a tiny
scratch can have
fatal results.

name: nidorina
bio:
When feeding its
young, it first
chews and tender­ izes the food,
then spits it out
for the offspring.

name: nidoqueen
bio:
Its body is cover­
ed with needle-
like scales. It never shows signs
of shrinking from
any attack.

name: nidoran-m
bio:
It is small, but
its horn is filled
with poison. It charges then stabs
with the horn to
inject poison.

name: nidorino
bio:
An aggressive
POKéMON that is
quick to attack. The horn on its
head secretes a
powerful venom.

name: nidoking
bio:
It swings its big
tail around during
battle. If its foe flinches, it will
charge with its
sturdy body.

name: clefairy
bio:
The moonlight that
it stores in the
wings on its back apparently gives
it the ability to
float in midair.

name: clefable
bio:
With its acute
hearing, it can
pick up sounds from far away. It
usually hides in
quiet places.

name: vulpix
bio:
As it develops, 
its single white
tail gains color and splits into
six. It is quite
warm and cuddly.

name: ninetales
bio:
Some legends claim
that each of its
nine tails has its own unique type
of special
mystical power.

name: jigglypuff
bio:
If it inflates to
SING a lullaby, it
can perform longer and cause sure
drowsiness in its
audience.

name: wigglytuff
bio:
Their fur feels so
good that if two
of them snuggle together, they
won't want to be
separated.

name: zubat
bio:
Forms colonies in
perpetually dark
places. Uses ultrasonic waves
to identify and
approach targets.

name: golbat
bio:
However hard its
victim's hide may
be, it punctures with sharp fangs
and gorges itself
with blood.

name: oddish
bio:
Awakened by moon­
light, it roams 
actively at night. In the day, it
stays quietly
underground.

name: gloom
bio:
What appears to be
drool is actually
sweet honey. It is very sticky and
clings stubbornly
if touched.

name: vileplume
bio:
The larger its
petals, the more
toxic pollen it contains. Its big
head is heavy and
hard to hold up.

name: paras
bio:
It is doused with
mushroom spores
when it is born. As its body grows,
mushrooms sprout
from its back.

name: parasect
bio:
It stays mostly in
dark, damp places,
the preference not of the bug, but
of the big mush­
rooms on its back.

name: venonat
bio:
Its eyes also
function as radar
units. It catches and eats small
bugs that hide in
darkness.

name: venomoth
bio:
The powdery scales
on its wings are
hard to remove. They also contain
poison that leaks
out on contact.

name: diglett
bio:
It prefers dark
places. It spends
most of its time underground,
though it may pop
up in caves.

name: dugtrio
bio:
Its three heads
bob separately up
and down to loosen the soil nearby,
making it easier
for it to burrow.

name: meowth
bio:
Appears to be more
active at night.
It loves round and shiny things.
It can't stop from
picking them up.

name: persian
bio:
Many adore it for
its sophisticated
air. However, it will lash out and
scratch for little
reason.

name: psyduck
bio:
It has mystical
powers but doesn't
recall that it has used them. That is
why it always
looks puzzled.

name: golduck
bio:
When it swims at
full speed using
its long, webbed limbs, its fore­
head somehow be­
gins to glow.

name: mankey
bio:
It is extremely
ill-tempered.
Groups of them will attack any
handy target for
no reason.

name: primeape
bio:
If approached
while asleep, it
may awaken and angrily give chase
in a groggy state
of semi-sleep.

name: growlithe
bio:
It has a brave and
trustworthy na­
ture. It fear­ lessly stands up
to bigger and
stronger foes.

name: arcanine
bio:
This legendary
Chinese POKEMON is
considered magnif­ icent. Many people
are enchanted by
its grand mane.

name: poliwag
bio:
Because it is in­
ept at walking on
its newly grown legs, it always 
swims around in
water.

name: poliwhirl
bio:
The swirl on its
belly subtly un­
dulates. Staring at it may gradual­
ly cause drowsi­
ness.

name: poliwrath
bio:
This strong and
skilled swimmer is
even capable of crossing the
Pacific Ocean just
by kicking.

name: abra
bio:
It senses impend­
ing attacks and
TELEPORTS away to safety before the
actual attacks can
strike.

name: kadabra
bio:
It possesses
strong spiritual
power. The more danger it faces,
the stronger its
psychic power.

name: alakazam
bio:
Closing both its
eyes heightens all
its other senses. This enables it to
use its abilities
to their extremes.

name: machop
bio:
Very powerful in
spite of its small
size. Its mastery of many types of
martial arts makes
it very tough.

name: machoke
bio:
It always goes at
its full power,
but this very tough and durable
POKéMON never gets
tired.

name: machamp
bio:
It quickly swings
its four arms to
rock its opponents with ceaseless
punches and chops
from all angles.

name: bellsprout
bio:
Even though its
body is extremely
skinny, it is blindingly fast
when catching its
prey.

name: weepinbell
bio:
Even though it is
filled with ACID,
it does not melt because it also
oozes a neutral­
izing fluid.

name: victreebel
bio:
Said to live in
huge colonies
deep in jungles, although no one
has ever returned
from there.

name: tentacool
bio:
When the tide goes
out, dehydrated
TENTACOOL remains can be found
washed up on the
shore.

name: tentacruel
bio:
Its 80 tentacles
absorb water and
stretch almost endlessly to CON­
STRICT its prey
and enemies.

name: geodude
bio:
Most people may
not notice, but
a closer look should reveal that
there are many
GEODUDE around.

name: graveler
bio:
Often seen rolling
down mountain
trails. Obstacles are just things to
roll straight
over, not avoid.

name: golem
bio:
It sheds its skin
once a year. The
discarded shell immediately hard­
ens and crumbles
away.

name: ponyta
bio:
It is a weak run­
ner immediately
after birth. It gradually becomes
faster by chasing
after its parents.

name: rapidash
bio:
Just loves to run.
If it sees some­
thing faster than itself, it will
give chase at top
speed.

name: slowpoke
bio:
Incredibly slow
and dopey. It
takes 5 seconds for it to feel
pain when under
attack.

name: slowbro
bio:
If the tail-biting
SHELLDER is thrown
off in a harsh battle, it reverts
to being an ordi­
nary SLOWPOKE.

name: magnemite
bio:
It is attracted by
electromagnetic
waves. It may approach trainers
if they are using
their POKéGEAR.

name: magneton
bio:
Three MAGNEMITE
are linked by a
strong magnetic force. Earaches
will occur if you
get too close.

name: farfetchd
bio:
If anyone tries to
disturb where the
essential plant sticks grow, it
uses its own stick
to thwart them.

name: doduo
bio:
By alternately
raising and lower­
ing its two heads, it balances itself
to be more stable
while running.

name: dodrio
bio:
One of DODUO's 2
heads splits to
form a unique species. It runs
close to 40 MPH
in prairies.

name: seel
bio:
Although it can't
walk well on land,
it is a graceful swimmer. It espe­
cially loves being
in frigid seas.

name: dewgong
bio:
Its streamlined
body has little
drag in water. The colder the
temperature, the
friskier it gets.

name: grimer
bio:
As it moves, it
loses bits of its
body from which new GRIMER emerge.
This worsens the
stench around it.

name: muk
bio:
They love to gath­
er in smelly areas
where sludge ac­ cumulates, making
the stench around
them worse.

name: shellder
bio:
It swims facing
backward by open­
ing and closing its two-piece
shell. It is
surprisingly fast.

name: cloyster
bio:
Once it slams its
shell shut, it is
impossible to open, even by
those with superi­
or strength.

name: gastly
bio:
With its gas-like
body, it can sneak
into any place it desires. However,
it can be blown
away by wind.

name: haunter
bio:
In total darkness,
where nothing is
visible, HAUNTER lurks, silently
stalking its next
victim.

name: gengar
bio:
It steals heat
from its surround­
ings. If you feel a sudden chill, it
is certain that a
GENGAR appeared.

name: onix
bio:
It twists and
squirms through
the ground. The thunderous roar of
its tunneling
echoes a long way.

name: drowzee
bio:
If you think that
you had a good
dream, but you can't remember it,
a DROWZEE has
probably eaten it.

name: hypno
bio:
When it is very
hungry, it puts
humans it meets to sleep, then it
feasts on their
dreams.

name: krabby
bio:
If it senses dan­
ger approaching,
it cloaks itself with bubbles from
its mouth so it
will look bigger.

name: kingler
bio:
It can hardly
lift its massive,
overgrown pincer. The pincer's size
makes it difficult
to aim properly.

name: voltorb
bio:
It rolls to move.
If the ground is
uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting
a bump can cause
it to explode.

name: electrode
bio:
It is dangerous.
If it has too much
electricity and has nothing to do,
it amuses itself
by exploding.

name: exeggcute
bio:
The shell is very
durable. Even if
it cracks, it can survive without
spilling the
contents.

name: exeggutor
bio:
Its three heads
think independent­
ly. However, they are friendly and
never appear to
squabble.

name: cubone
bio:
If it is sad or
lonely, the skull
it wears shakes, and emits a plain­
tive and mournful
sound.

name: marowak
bio:
Small and weak,
this POKéMON is
adept with its bone club. It has
grown more vicious
over the ages.

name: hitmonlee
bio:
This amazing POKé­
MON has an awesome
sense of balance. It can kick in
succession from
any position.

name: hitmonchan
bio:
Its punches slice
the air. However,
it seems to need a short break after
fighting for three
minutes.

name: lickitung
bio:
Its tongue has
well-developed
nerves that run to the very tip,
so it can be deft­
ly manipulated.

name: koffing
bio:
Its thin, filmy
body is filled
with gases that cause constant
sniffles, coughs
and teary eyes.

name: weezing
bio:
If one of the twin
KOFFING inflates,
the other one deflates. It con­
stantly mixes its
poisonous gases.

name: rhyhorn
bio:
It is inept at
turning because of
its four short legs. It can only
charge and run in
one direction.

name: rhydon
bio:
Its rugged hide
protects it from
even the heat of lava. However, the
hide also makes it
insensitive.

name: chansey
bio:
It walks carefully
to prevent its
egg from breaking. However, it is
extremely fast at
running away.

name: tangela
bio:
The vines that
cloak its entire
body are always jiggling. They
effectively un­
nerve its foes.

name: kangaskhan
bio:
If it is safe, the
young gets out of
the belly pouch to play. The adult
keeps a close eye
on the youngster.

name: horsea
bio:
If attacked by a
larger enemy, it
quickly swims to safety by adeptly
controlling its
dorsal fin.

name: seadra
bio:
An examination of
its cells revealed
the presence of a gene not found in
HORSEA. It became
a hot topic.

name: goldeen
bio:
Its dorsal, pecto­
ral and tail fins
wave elegantly in water. That is why
it is known as the
water dancer.

name: seaking
bio:
It is the male's
job to make a
nest by carving out boulders in a
stream using the
horn on its head.

name: staryu
bio:
As long as the
center section is
unharmed, it can grow back fully
even if it is
chopped to bits.

name: starmie
bio:
The center section
of its body is
called the core. It glows in a dif­
ferent color each
time it is seen.

name: mr-mime
bio:
A skilled mime
from birth, it
gains the ability to create invisi­
ble objects as it
matures.

name: scyther
bio:
It slashes through
grass with its
sharp scythes, moving too fast
for the human eye
to track.

name: jynx
bio:
It rocks its body
rhythmically. It
appears to alter the rhythm depend­
ing on how it is
feeling.

name: electabuzz
bio:
Electricity runs
across the surface
of its body. In darkness, its en­
tire body glows a
whitish-blue.

name: magmar
bio:
It dislikes cold
places, so it
blows scorching flames to make the
environment suit­
able for itself.

name: pinsir
bio:
With its horns, it
digs burrows to
sleep in at night. In the morning,
damp soil clings
to its body.

name: tauros
bio:
They fight each
other by locking
horns. The herd's protector takes
pride in its bat­
tle-scarred horns.

name: magikarp
bio:
An underpowered,
pathetic POKéMON.
It may jump high on rare occasions,
but never more
than seven feet.

name: gyarados
bio:
Rarely seen in
the wild. Huge
and vicious, it is capable of
destroying entire
cities in a rage.

name: lapras
bio:
They have gentle
hearts. Because
they rarely fight, many have been
caught. Their num­
ber has dwindled.

name: ditto
bio:
It can transform
into anything.
When it sleeps, it changes into a
stone to avoid
being attacked.

name: eevee
bio:
It has the ability
to alter the com­
position of its body to suit its
surrounding envi­
ronment.

name: vaporeon
bio:
When VAPOREON's
fins begin to vi­
brate, it is a sign that rain
will come within a
few hours.

name: jolteon
bio:
It concentrates
the weak electric
charges emitted by its cells and
launches wicked
lightning bolts.

name: flareon
bio:
It stores some of
the air it inhales
in its internal flame pouch, which
heats it to over
3,000 degrees.

name: porygon
bio:
It is a manmade
POKéMON. Since it
doesn't breathe, people are eager
to try it in any
environment.

name: omanyte
bio:
Revived from an
ancient fossil,
this POKéMON uses air stored in its
shell to sink and
rise in water.

name: omastar
bio:
Apparently, it
cracked SHELLDER's
shell with its sharp fangs and
sucked out the
insides.

name: kabuto
bio:
On rare occasions,
some have been
found as fossils which they became
while hiding on
the ocean floor.

name: kabutops
bio:
A slim and fast
swimmer. It slices
its prey with its sharp sickles and
drinks the body
fluids.

name: aerodactyl
bio:
A savage POKéMON
that died out in
ancient times. It was resurrected
using DNA taken
from amber.

name: snorlax
bio:
What sounds like
its cry may ac­
tually be its snores or the
rumblings of its
hungry belly.

name: articuno
bio:
The magnificent,
seemingly translu­
cent wings of this legendary bird
POKéMON are said
to be made of ice.

name: zapdos
bio:
This legendary
bird POKéMON is
said to appear when the sky turns
dark and lightning
showers down.

name: moltres
bio:
This legendary
POKéMON scatters
embers with every flap of its wings.
It is a thrilling
sight to behold.

name: dratini
bio:
It is born large
to start with. It
repeatedly sheds its skin as it
steadily grows
longer.

name: dragonair
bio:
According to a
witness, its body
was surrounded by a strange aura
that gave it a
mystical look.

name: dragonite
bio:
It is said that
this POKéMON con­
stantly flies over the immense seas
and rescues drown­
ing people.

name: mewtwo
bio:
Because its battle
abilities were
raised to the ultimate level, it
thinks only of de­
feating its foes.

name: mew
bio:
Apparently, it
appears only to
those people who are pure of heart
and have a strong
desire to see it.
